comments:
Build Number: V2.2.0 1117 and V 2.1.1 1122

Step to reproduce:
1.Create a data source named d1(jdbc:jtds:sqlserver://spmdb:1433/test) and a data set named ds1(select * from employee)
2.Insert a data "row["First"]." and select "toUpperCase()" in String Function.
3.Press OK.

Actual result:
row["First"].toLocaleLowerCase() and row["First"].toLocaleUpperCase() have error message when preview.

Erro log:

Data (id = 23): 
- A BIRT exception occurred: Error evaluating Javascript expression. Script engine error: TypeError: toLocaleUpperCase is not a function.

<compiled script>. See next exception for more information.

<compiled script>

BIRT uses rhino as the javascript engine, the toLocaleUpperCase/toLocaleLowerCase is not supported by rhino yet,

https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=361616

Suggest to remove those two methods from the supported method list.
reassign to GUI team for more investigation.
Mozilla rhino has provided the lack supports recently, please have a check. Maybe we need to update the rhino plugin.

the latest version of rhino is 1.6rc5
and all works fine after replace the old js.jar

we will close this bug after BIRT updating a new version.
